- Prefer Julia standard libraries, avoid new packages unless explicitly requested.

# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

1. Identify the column to clean (`col`). 
 2. Lowercase the entire column using `lowercase(col)`. 
 3. Strip leading and trailing whitespaces from the column by using `strip(col)`.
4. Replace any spaces or hyphens with underscores: `replace(col, " " => "_", "-" => "_")`

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString) 
    col = lowercase(col)   # lowercase the column name
    col = strip(col)       # remove leading and trailing whitespaces
    return replace(col, " " => "_", "-" => "_") # replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
end
```
This function takes a single argument (`col`) representing the column to clean. It first lowercases the string using `lowercase`, then uses `strip` to remove leading and trailing whitespaces, and finally replaces spaces and hyphens with underscores using `replace`.

Please note that I have added a type constraint (AbstractString) to the argument col in order to constrain it as a String. This will prevent any other data types from being passed into the function.
